title: Jury in Charlottesville Unite the Right Rally Trial Verdict Finds Leaders Liable
sub_head: Victims of violence from 2017 march in Virginia are awarded more than $25 million
body:
A federal jury in Virginia on Tuesday awarded victims of violence stemming from a 2017 assembly in Charlottesville, Va., more than $25 million, after finding a group of prominent white supremacist leaders and groups liable on four counts relating to racially motivated violence during a torchlight march and Unite the Right rally.
The jury deadlocked on two other counts.
